TopicTitle: what is the most random thing you have done in ksp

Articles.Content: so far the weirdest thing i have done is create a giant metal sheild around kerbin
I'll believe that when I see it.
what i did was use hyperedit and the size changer mod to make a ton of panels around kerbin i cnat screeenshot cuase of he lag

Make 4 spotlight mk1 hovering mechjeb controlled radial engine.. It made the perfect sky-light for outdoors 

 

That and I built a perfect glider.. She soared beautifully.. Landed like a feather.. 

It just wasnt kerbal..

 

So i hit it with whack a kerbal and smashed bits off.. Then it flew like a rock.. Much better

Edited January 14, 2016 by Overland

That award probably goes to this:

It's a turtle I made several months ago. It flies a short ways by rocket. I was planning on making a giant turtle that could go to space but my attention was captured by other projects, just like every other thing I've done in KSP. It came about when a friend of mine said to me: "One does not simply make a turtle in KSP." What's funny is this took me about five minutes in the VAB.

Edited January 14, 2016 by cubinator
I don't know about random things in KSP, but here's a relevant xkcd:

Do you hate science hogging too? But you know there are those times when you just need 2.7 points of sci for something that would be reeeal useful on the upcoming mission. Those times we call... the sci-hog!
Built a rover with dedicated launch/lander system. Just to drop six ground base thingys with winches and ports on around the mining site.
